definition: to give sb a word of advice/advice/counsel/a wise word
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: I'll give you some advice, Mike, don't try.
sentences.chinese: 迈克，我要给你些忠告，别去试。

sentences.english: My advice is to purchase something Japenese.
But she says parents have to try.
sentences.chinese: 但是她忠告父母们必须试试。

sentences.english: I shall/will act as you advise.
Here are some tips to help you boost your word power.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一些忠告来帮助你增强字汇能力。

sentences.english: Those are blunt, unyielding admonitions that ring in my head every day.
sentences.chinese: 那些直言不讳的忠告每天都在我头脑中响起。

sentences.english: If the old dog barks,he gives counsel.
Connie often turns to her priest for advice.
sentences.chinese: 康妮常会向她的牧师寻求忠告。

sentences.english: Most of the tips in the book seem to be about the vices to avoid.
sentences.chinese: 书中大部分的忠告似乎都在讲应该避免哪些缺点。

sentences.english: I need your advice and support.
sentences.chinese: 我需要你的忠告和支持。

sentences.english: Your good advices were still ringing in my ear long after you said them.
sentences.chinese: 你的忠告久久地回响在我的耳边。

sentences.english: Then he goes on to give this young pastor some good fatherly advice.
sentences.chinese: 接著，他又慈爱的给这位年轻的牧者一些忠告。

sentences.english: The control-room listened carefully and then advised the astronauts.
sentences.chinese: 控制室仔细地听着，然后给宇航员提出忠告。

sentences.english: How would you relay advice to new clubs?
sentences.chinese: 你如何将忠告转传给新社？

sentences.english: We have derived a great deal of benefit from her advice.
sentences.chinese: 我们从她的忠告中得到很多益处。

sentences.english: If the old dog barks, he give the counsel.

definition: may I offer a bit of advice
an experienced person/sb who has "been around (the block)"/sb who has personally experienced it
words from the bottom of one's heart
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
meaningful and heartfelt words (idiom); sincere and earnest wishes
loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
